info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 2:44AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...GUSTY SHOWERS WILL MOVE OVER KAUAI FROM THE WEST... At 245 AM HST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of heavy showers and gusty winds about 18 miles west of Barking Sands, or 43 miles west of Lihue, moving east near 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kalaheo, Kekaha, Mana, Alakai Swamp Trails, Na Pali State Park, Hanapepe, Omao, Barking Sands, Wainiha, Koloa, Lawai, Waimea, Kokee State Park, Haena, Poipu, North Fork Wailua Trails, Hanalei, Waimea Canyon State Park, Kaumakani, and Pakala Village. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
